intro: Crepis jubata, commonly known as the silver hairgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, silver-tinged leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite inflorescences, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Crepis jubata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage and floral display.
